item.title: Report E-2024020173
item.description:
Report E-2024020173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a 55lb bag containing Succinic Anhydride (UN1758) punctured as a result of dunnage resulting in a 2lb release of product onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor neutralized the released material with Soda Ash and containerized the spill debris into an 05 PAIL for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this release.

item.title: Report E-2024020152
item.description:
Report E-2024020152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: ELDRIDGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 4, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged in transit due to unknown causes and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enviromark (EM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a degreaser and absorbent pads to remove product from the impacted dock floor. Additional granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted trailer and worked in with hand tools. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 80-gallon overpack drum for disposal. The cardboard and all UN1263-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024020078
item.description:
Report E-2024020078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: FORT DODGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFO experienced a UN3082 Caromax 28 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 3’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 55- gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020083
item.description:
Report E-2024020083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 fell in transit and released approximately one (1) liter of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.
